DataElement.preferredName: Grade 2 Hospitalization Greater Equal Grade 3 Adverse Event Adverse Event No Previous Report Occurrence Yes No Coded Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value to signify whether a grade 2 adverse event with hospitalization or a greater than or equal to grade 3 adverse event that was not previously reported occurred.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Grade 2 Hospitalization Greater Than or Equal To Grade 3 Adverse Event Adverse Event No Previous Report Occurrence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An experience that is alleviated with simple therapeutic treatments. The event impacts usual daily activities. Includes laboratory test alterations indicating injury, but without long-term risk.  See NCI Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events._The condition of being treated as a patient in a hospital._A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways._An adverse event experience that requires intensive therapeutic intervention and interrupts usual daily activities._Any unfavorable or unintended symptom, sign, or disease including an abnormal laboratory finding) temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure.  Such events can be intervention related, dose related, route related, patient related, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s)._The non-affirmative response to a question._Occurring prior to something else._A short textual account; having provided a short account._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Moderate Adverse Event Hospitalization Greater Than or Equal To Severe Adverse Event Adverse Event
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An experience that is alleviated with simple therapeutic treatments. The event impacts usual daily activities. Includes laboratory test alterations indicating injury, but without long-term risk.  See NCI Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events.:The condition of being treated as a patient in a hospital.:A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.:An adverse event experience that requires intensive therapeutic intervention and interrupts usual daily activities.:Any unfavorable or unintended symptom, sign, or disease including an abnormal laboratory finding) temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure.  Such events can be intervention related, dose related, route related, patient related, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

Concepts.definition: An experience that is alleviated with simple therapeutic treatments. The event impacts usual daily activities. Includes laboratory test alterations indicating injury, but without long-term risk.
The condition of being treated as a patient in a hospital.

A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.
An adverse event experience that requires intensive therapeutic intervention and interrupts usual daily activities.

Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

Property.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.:Occurring prior to something else.:A short textual account; having provided a short account.:An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.
A short textual account; having provided a short account.
An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Yes or No response to a question coded as 1 (Yes) or 2 (No).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.29 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated to add NCIt concept relationship. Updated VM Short Name to be the Public ID to be consistent with current convention for VM Short Name - DW 10-03-2022
ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.29 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. ak

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has the patient had a grade 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had a grade 2 with hospitalization or grade 3+ that has not been previously reported?

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support NCI caAERS integration with Rave 6.2014 D.Reeves
